children.subject: I personally think it's only worthwhile if you take EE123 too. EE120 just teaches you all the math, but I felt like 123 taught more of the actual applications of signal processing.
Yes, you can. But you always need instructor approval to take any graduate courses.
Can undergrads take EE225b? Or do you need instructor approval for it since it's technically a grad course?

I plan to take EECS225B this coming spring
 What do I need to pass through it successfully? And how did you got permission from the professor?

history.content:
I am interested in the general land of Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Vision. Currently taking 290T (3D Recognition) and previously took EE225B (Image Processing) and did very well. I am enrolled in EE120 right now but am having doubts about its usefulness in the long run. On one hand, having SP fundamentals seems useful but on the other, I feel like my time is better spent taking classes more relevant to ML or even software-centric classes.

I want to go to grad school too (to focus somewhere in the aforementioned fields), but again, I am not sure if I truly need EE120.

Other classes/extracurriculars I am taking right now are 189, 290T, a breadth, and 2 research labs.

Any advice would be greatly appreciated!
history.subject: Is EE120 worth taking?
